body: Avicus has a small competitive community, it doesn't make any sense to have large team sizes. I think to increase competition, reduce teams sizes to 5 or 6 and and have a maximum of 12 players, similar to OCN. This will make games more interesting and more teams. It'll also make scrims less rare since you don't need 10 players
body_tagged: Avicus has a small competitive community, it doesn't make any sense to have large team sizes. I think to increase competition, reduce teams sizes to 5 or 6 and and have a maximum of 12 players, similar to OCN. This will make games more interesting and more teams. It'll also make scrims less rare since you don't need 10 players
title: Reduce team sizes for tourneys

replies.body: I like the idea but 5 or 6 members per team is to low. I think that the team rosters should be reduce to 16 member per team. So, if the Official Team do it we'll have more teams=more competitive.It's just my opinion.

replies.body:
Tbh i think it depends what kind of tourney.

DTM and CTW are mostly 10v10 so minimum 8 players max 10, 18 registered

TDM is 8v8 so min 6 max 8 with roster of 16

somethibg small like lanes would be like 5v5 or 6v6 so the roster size would be like 14 or 15

i think varying the amount of players (at least on field) would be cool dpeneding on the gamemmode

replies.body: More teams being created, which leads to less players on a team, which also means the chance of players making a tourney time are reduced. Yes, it does bring more competition but also if a team that has 16 players on it, and only six for example show up for a tourney, how do you expect the smaller teams to?<br id="null">

replies.body:
Personally, I think the next tournament will be Atlas inspired, meaning KoTH/CTF and probably CTW thrown in too. 

If those game modes are chosen, then I think 6v6 could work, but rosters would be cut down. 

I am not referring to Apollo at all when I say this... I highly doubt the large, successful teams will split into two to account for their roster size. Meaning the whole idea it'll create more teams is invalid and the only effect is players being kicked out of rosters.

I am not saying that will happen (because I can't foresee the future, unfortunately) and this is just how I see it.
